frameDefinitions: An Operator manipulates the substructure of a System such that the System performs the function it was created for.
An Agent expends effort towards achieving a Goal.
An Agent manipulates an Instrument in order to achieve a Purpose.
These are words referring to control by a Leader over a particular entity  or group (the Governed) or an Activity.
This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings.
frameExamples: This true story of domestic bliss was related to me by a friend of mine who for a time <t>operated</t> a bar in San Francisco.
In addition, our organization will <t>work</t> on improving accountability in every department.
For cold conditions, we recommend that you <t>use</t> a heat gun or a hair dryer to make the adhesive work better.
Sebek em hat was a <t>Leader</t> of Priests. ca. 1780 BC
listRoleDefinitions: The entity that  the <fen>Operator</fen> gets to perform its intended function.
The invididual who manipulates the substructure of the <fen>System</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Operator</fen> runs the <fen>System</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Operator</fen> runs the <fen>System</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> puts effort into reaching <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> expends effort to achieve.
An entity that is centrally involved in the <fen>Goal</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> is attempting to acheive.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the effort occurs.
The place where the work is done.
The Agent uses the Instrument to achieve their Purpose.
This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent uses the Instrument.
An entity directed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that serves to bring about the <fen>Purpose</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
An <fen>Instrument</fen> that has a function associated with it.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Instrument</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the Agent uses the Instrument.

The <fen>Leader</fen> is the one who has the role of leading.  With verbs, and with predicate nominals linking an individual to a <fen>Role</fen>, the <fen>Leader</fen> is usually the External Argument:

The role played by the <fen>Leader</fen> in a given situation, often an official title; incorporated in most noun LUsin this frame. When expressed separately from the target, <fen>Role</fen> usually occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>as</ment>.
The entity whose actions or beliefs the <fen>Leader</fen> directs in the context of a joint activity or movement.  This entity can be a political body, a person, or a group of people.
The <fen>Leader</fen> directs the <fen>Activity</fen>.
<fen>Time</fen> refers to the point in time that the leadership took place.
The locale from which the <fen>Leader</fen> leads the <fen>Governed</fen> or the <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs.
listRoleExamples: Robert Faye, who has run <fex>the organization</fex> since its inception in 1991, said all the money the group has raised has been properly distributed.
<fex>WELS Kingdom Workers</fex> operates this program for students interested in doing ministry for a summer job.

This guaranteed donation to the charity was begun by Eric Von Stroh, Mike Cioli
and Andrew Seligson, the three men who ran the business <fex>last year</fex>.
North Korea Operates a Restaurant <fex>in Vietnam</fex>.
For cold conditions, we recommend using <fex>a heat gun or a hair dryer</fex> to make the adhesive work better.
Mirabella shared the mischievous vision of childlike exuberance and used the chair <fex>as a pseudo jungle gym</fex>.
I went and used that ball <fex>yesterday</fex> and i bowled 5 games and i left about 14 ten pins with it.
The general led his troops into battle <fex>on June 22, 1883</fex>.
He ruled the west <fex>from his palace in Milan</fex>.
